medical_history.chief_complaint: Generalized aches, malaise, anorexia, and fevers lasting 1 week.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 week prior to presentation, with fluctuating intensity. The patient reported fever, cough, and persistent right upper quadrant pain, but no nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea. Symptoms fluctuated over the next month with ongoing right upper quadrant pain, cough, and fevers.
medical_history.family_history: Notable for giant-cell arteritis in her mother and prostate and colon cancer in her father.
medical_history.social_history: Works for a nonprofit organization, lives in New England, has not traveled recently, and has no pets.
